channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Shooting at Brown University kills two, others injured, says Mayor of Providence
item.description: Mayor Brett Smiley of Providence, Rhode Island says two people are dead and multiple people hurt after a shooting at Brown University.
item.content:encoded: Mayor Brett Smiley of Providence, Rhode Island says two people are dead and multiple people hurt after a shooting at Brown University.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Birth mothers call for more government support
item.description: There are more federal tax cuts in the works for people who adopt children. Birth mothers say they also want financial support so they don't have to place their infants up for adoption.
item.content:encoded: There are more federal tax cuts in the works for people who adopt children. Birth mothers say they also want financial support so they don't have to place their infants up for adoption.
item.dc:creator: T.J. Raphael

item.title: 2 killed and 9 injured in Brown University shooting, no suspect in custody
item.description: Authorities are searching for a suspect described as "a male dressed in black" who fled the Ivy League's Rhode Island campus on foot following the Saturday afternoon shooting.
item.content:encoded:
Authorities are searching for a suspect described as "a male dressed in black" who fled the Ivy League's Rhode Island campus on foot following the Saturday afternoon shooting.

(Image credit: Mark Stockwell/AP)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: United Airlines flight returns to Dulles airport after engine loses power during takeoff
item.description: Shortly after departing the Virginia airport on Saturday, the Tokyo-bound plane's engine cover separated and caught fire, according to the transportation secretary. No injuries were reported.
item.content:encoded:
Shortly after departing the Virginia airport on Saturday, the Tokyo-bound plane's engine cover separated and caught fire, according to the transportation secretary. No injuries were reported.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: After failure in the Senate, House GOP has its own health care proposal
item.description: House Republicans released proposed legislation late Friday that would not extend enhanced Affordable Care Act tax subsidies.
item.content:encoded:
House Republicans released proposed legislation late Friday that would not extend enhanced Affordable Care Act tax subsidies.

(Image credit: Kevin Wolf/AP)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: Skywatchers rejoice: The Geminids meteor shower peaks tonight
item.description: The Geminids meteor shower appears every December, but it will peak this year on Saturday, the 13th.
item.content:encoded:
The Geminids meteor shower appears every December, but it will peak this year on Saturday, the 13th.

(Image credit: Ye Aung Thu)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: 2 U.S. service members and 1 civilian are killed in ISIS attack in Syria
item.description: The attack, which took place in the city of Palmyra, comes a year after the fall of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and the lifting of U.S. sanctions.
item.content:encoded:
The attack, which took place in the city of Palmyra, comes a year after the fall of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and the lifting of U.S. sanctions.

(Image credit: Omar Haj Kadour)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: Church Nativity scenes add zip ties and gas masks to protest immigration raids
item.description: Supporters of the displays say the Bible is on their side, but critics call the scenes sacrilegious and politically divisive, accusing the churches of abusing sacred imagery.
item.content:encoded:
Supporters of the displays say the Bible is on their side, but critics call the scenes sacrilegious and politically divisive, accusing the churches of abusing sacred imagery.

(Image credit: Erin Hooley)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Fired Michigan football coach charged with home invasion and stalking
item.description: Fired University of Michigan football coach Sherrone Moore "barged his way" into the apartment of a woman with whom he had been having an affair after she reported the relationship to the school and he lost his job, prosecutors said.
item.content:encoded:
Fired University of Michigan football coach Sherrone Moore "barged his way" into the apartment of a woman with whom he had been having an affair after she reported the relationship to the school and he lost his job, prosecutors said.

(Image credit: Al Goldis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The latest updates on the flooding in Washington state
item.description: People in Washington state who have evacuated from floods may have to wait for weeks before returning home.
item.content:encoded: People in Washington state who have evacuated from floods may have to wait for weeks before returning home.
item.dc:creator: Scott Greenstone
